page.title: 19LIFE IN BOOTHBY PAGNELL,1985
page.content: The population of Boothby Pagnell has gone down in the past 20 years.It is now around 100.Another thing that has changed is that when my cousin was a girl,everyone knew everyone else in the village.Now she doesn't know half the people who live there.She says that there are mostly town people who live in the village and commute to the towns and cities nearby.A lot of them work in London. The post-office used to be a post-office cum general store but now there is no call for it.It now only sells eggs from my cousin's farm.There are no mobile shops anymore either. Even so the villagers get their milk and newspapers delivered to them. There is one telephone box in the village.The bus service runs through the village around five times a day when it travels between nearby towns.
